sub_topic: Finding the derivative of a function
message_1: Find the derivative of the function f(x) = 3x^2 - 4x + 1 when x = 5.
message_2:
To find the derivative of the function f(x) = 3x^2 - 4x + 1, we will first find the derivative with respect to x and then evaluate it at x = 5.

The derivative of f(x) with respect to x is:

f'(x) = d(3x^2 - 4x + 1)/dx

Using the power rule for differentiation, we get:

f'(x) = 6x - 4

Now, we will evaluate the derivative at x = 5:

f'(5) = 6(5) - 4
f'(5) = 30 - 4
f'(5) = 26

So, the derivative of the function f(x) = 3x^2 - 4x + 1 when x = 5 is 26.
